description: Construction of single storey, two-bed, detached dwelling, with basement, one off-street car parking space, bike parking space, refuse storage, private amenity space, boundary treatment and a new vehicle crossing, following demolition of a group of six garages.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers PP - 00OR - 03 (Rev B); PP - 00OR - 04 (Rev B); PP - 00OR - 05 (Rev B) (received 06/02/2015).  REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2(f) (g), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015), and section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No occupation of the dwelling hereby approved shall take place until full details of boundary treatments relating to the front of the property, including the proposed gate, hard/soft landscape works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be completed as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development.   REASON: To secure a high quality development in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, and in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015). | Details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, for the insulation of the building envelope. The details shall also include the noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided. The insulation shall achieve the internal criteria for sensitive room, in accordance with local planning authority standards using the specified worst mode one hour LAeq, 1hr spectrum noise level. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the proposed dwelling and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure that the future occupiers of the approved development are adequately protected against air traffic noise, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015) and to Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the residential unit hereby approved shall be constructed to achieve to a minimum Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes. The associated reports/ assessment and certifications to demonstrate compliance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval as follows:  "	Within 3 months of the commencement of construction of the development (Interim Design Stage Assessment and related certification)   "	After completion of Development and prior to first occupation. A Post-Construction Code for Sustainable Homes Review/Report.  "	6 months after the date of first occupation of the development. Post-Construction Stage Certificates verified by the BRE, confirming level 4 has been achieved.  REASON:  To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015); 1.1 (k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; policy 5.2 of Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the November 2010 Technical Guide and addendum 2014 for England Technical Guidance. | Existing trees adjacent/close to the boundaries of the site shall not be felled or otherwise affected in any way (including altering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees), with the exception of pruning trees back to the boundary of the site, unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority. Protection of the trees, hedgerows and groups of mature shrubs off site that are adjacent/close to it shall be fully implemented and maintained fully intact and (in the case of the fencing) at all times, until the completion of all building operations on the site.  Reason:  In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity of the Conservation Area as a whole, in pursuance to the objectives of section 11 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015),  policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f) (h), 2.1(c) and 2.10  of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines' and British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations'. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications),  no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole,  in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015).
